definition: to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: The portrait, painted in a simple but elegant style, has a romantic flavor.
sentences.chinese: 画面墨淡气雅，设色颇有浪漫主义韵味。

sentences.english: In the Dunhuang mural paintings, there exists a great amount of information about coloring practices during and before Tang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 敦煌的壁画保存了大量唐及唐以前的绘画设色资料。

sentences.english: The difficulties of colouring a map rest mainly on the vagueness in the colour perception.
sentences.chinese: 地图设色之困难，在于色彩感受的不确定性。

sentences.english: The Yangjiabu's board pictures are discussed in the area of the region, subject matter and color.
sentences.chinese: 探讨杨家埠木版年画的色彩特征与设色规律。

definition: blue-and-green landscape (genre of landscape painting originating in the Tang dynasty, in which blues and greens predominate)
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
vertical scroll (painting or calligraphy)/vertical shaft (of a machine)
accurate depiction of architectural forms with the aid of a ruler (technique of Chinese art)/picture created using this technique
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
relief shading (in a picture)/fig. to throw into relief
Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
